item.title: Next Event
item.description:
Next Event

"This rap artist deserves a much better dnb producer! The minimal, basic, no originality beats really dont go with the great rhymes" - liquidjunglist "Andy wildy is a fap widda Marijuana Steppin un mi knee they cant swim up my Pirhanna Any time me Drunk me go Pee Dung a wronga If I eat no Money say whiny bovril torquer Lemmy dry fee hold up bank with hard banana Cheryl pretty whole tits panorama Money for gunfire , Terry Wogan want no drama, with hi bumma baby mamma, whoah..."

item.title: Next event
item.description:
Next event

Hot on the heels of handing over the controls to Critical Music to give our new VOID soundsystem a proper work out, we bring you something a little different. Dancefloor favourites Annix, the duo made up of Konichi & Decimal Bass, will be joined on the one’s and two's by special guest TI to launch their album “Forever”. This will sell out, don't sleep on the half price early birds.

item.title: Joker Of The Scene: Dub Phizix | Red Bull Music Academy Daily
item.description:
Joker Of The Scene: Dub Phizix | Red Bull Music Academy Daily

Spend enough time in England and you'll come to learn that there is more to the country's North-South divide than just economic and political differences. Northerners aren't afraid to point the finger at themselves and laugh. In Manchester, self-deprecation is an integral part of daily life.

item.title: NEWSFLASH: Dub Phizix Has Recorded FABRICLIVE 84 - fabric blog
item.description:
NEWSFLASH: Dub Phizix Has Recorded FABRICLIVE 84 - fabric blog

His music, described by Mixmag as 'essential material', has an irreverent edge, yet is deadly serious in its dancefloor approach, reflecting the character of the Manchester producer, born George Ovens.

item.title: 5 Well Good Things You Should Know About Dub Phizix
item.description:

item.title: Annix - Warriors (ft. Killa P)
item.description:
Annix - Warriors (ft. Killa P)

Annix continues their spree of ridiculous tunes from their upcoming Forever LP with "Warriors" featuring the grime don Killa P on the vocals. Ridiculous!
